alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 7:34AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Furnas, Gosper, Harlan and Phelps. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Holdrege, Alma, Cambridge, Arapahoe, Oxford, Bertrand, Orleans, Loomis, Holbrook, Funk, Stamford, Republican City, Edison, Atlanta, Huntley, Ragan, Hollinger and Harlan County Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
